subsection.name: Anarchy and order
subsection.p: This is an evolving product. We don't make the perfect design from the start. We'll prbably never make the perfect design. We are always ready to refactor and improve our code. We make the simplest possible solutions, and add features only when they are requested
We mess with each other's code. If only the author understands the code, it sucks. Feel free to change anywhere. Using Subversion, we can always undo. Use the following versioning workflow:

ol.li: Run tests to verify that everything works
Commit using a revealing log message

tr.td: Unit tests of as much functional code as possible
Integration test cases, for testing collaboration with production environment
Java libraries that are not handled as maven dependencies.
Build directory, not to be included in source
Web contents, with one subdirectory per component (roughly)

JSPs will be copied to webapp at build time. During development they are treated as web contents to allow relative links. The location of JSPs inside www must reflect how they are mapped by the Request Dispatcher. For example repos.se/file.doc.jwa, maps to document, means document.jsp must be in root.
Where we document all important thoughts and decisions, except those that are allready in javadocs.
